definition: to explore/to survey/to prospect (for oil etc)/prospecting
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: More than one-third of exploratory wells came up dry.
sentences.chinese: 三分之一强的探勘井都是干井。

sentences.english: Columbus discovered America , but did not explore the new continent.
sentences.chinese: 哥伦布发现了美洲，但未探勘此新大陆。

sentences.english: The tour guide was well-prepared after his a scouting trip.
sentences.chinese: 这个导游在他的探勘之旅后准备相当充分。

sentences.english: Greatwall Energy Group is drilling oil wells in Illinois USA.
sentences.chinese: 长城能源集团在美国中西部探勘及开采油井。

definition: variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
Shenkang township in Taichung county 臺中縣|台中县[Tai2 zhong1 xian4], Taiwan
to restore a damaged or aging structure/to renovate
Mt Tatun, volcanic area to the north of Taipei
Qionglin or Chiunglin township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

pinyin: Jia1 li4 lu:e4 tan4 ce4 qi4
